intro: Plagiobothrys rufescens, commonly known as the redstem sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, clustered blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It has small, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Plagiobothrys rufescens is an important plant for pollinators and is often found in coastal and inland desert habitats.
